subtopics.par: The table below shows the Marginal Income Tax Brackets. Every American has to pay these taxes for the ranges that their salary covers.
The tables below show the difference between the tax calculations for someone who puts as much money as possible into a 401k versus someone who doesn't.
list: Standard Deduction - this amount ($12,500) is deducted from your total salary before your taxes are calculated. It's the only nice thing about taxes.
The government also charges a FICA tax (Federal Insurance Contributions Act) that contributes towards Social Security and Medicare. This is charged at 7.65%
You can defer you taxes to later (retirement, when your expnses and taxes are lower) to deduct even more from the taxes that you pay.

subtopics.par: The bottom line is, invest as much money as you can into your retirement accounts like your 401k and Roth IRA because it saves thousands.
